SENT.plain: Intracranial vasospasm following surgical removal of intracranial tumours is rare
To our knowledge there have been no previously reported cases of delayed vasospasm occurring post debulking of epidermoid cysts
We report a case in which vasospasm led to established cerebral infarction 2 weeks postoperatively
MRI and serial magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) reliably show initial multiple stenoses in the vertebral and internal carotid arteries followed by their spontaneous normalisation
MRA imaging is now of sufficient quality to enable it to be a safe and effective means of both looking for vasospasm and monitoring its resolution
